com.nokia.dempsy.router
Interface RoutingStrategy.Outbound

Enclosing interface:
RoutingStrategy
public static interface RoutingStrategy.Outbound

For every possible destination from a node to a downstream cluster there is an instance of an Outbound. The responsibility of the Outbound is to reliably determine which node (Destination) to send each message to for a given downstream cluster.

Nested Class Summary
static interface RoutingStrategy.Outbound.Coordinator
          Each node can have many Outbound instances and those Outbound cluster references can come and go.
 
Method Summary
 boolean completeInitialization()
          Since Outbound initialization can take place asynchronously, this method should be implemented to return true when the outbound's first successful initialization is complete.
 ClusterId getClusterId()
          The RoutingStrategy.Outbound is responsible for providing the ClusterId for which it is the RoutingStrategy.Outbound for.
 Destination selectDestinationForMessage(Object messageKey, Object message)
          This method needs to be implemented to determine the specific node that the outgoing message is to be routed to.
 void stop()
          Shut down and reclaim any resources associated with the RoutingStrategy.Outbound instance.
 

Method Detail

selectDestinationForMessage

Destination selectDestinationForMessage(Object messageKey,
                                        Object message)
                                        throws DempsyException
This method needs to be implemented to determine the specific node that the outgoing message is to be routed to.

Parameters:
messageKey - is the message key for the message to be routed
message - is the message to be routed.
Returns:
a transport Destination indicating the unique node in the downstream cluster that the message should go to.
Throws:
DempsyException - when something distasteful happens.

getClusterId

ClusterId getClusterId()
The RoutingStrategy.Outbound is responsible for providing the ClusterId for which it is the RoutingStrategy.Outbound for.

completeInitialization

boolean completeInitialization()
Since Outbound initialization can take place asynchronously, this method should be implemented to return true when the outbound's first successful initialization is complete. It's used to in tests to make sure that an application is completely initialized before proceeding.

stop

void stop()
Shut down and reclaim any resources associated with the RoutingStrategy.Outbound instance.
